makers.displaydate: 1923–1988, born Burlington, IN; died Martins Creek, PA; active New York, NY and New Brunswick, NJ
makers.displaymaker: Robert Watts, 1923–1988, born Burlington, IN; died Martins Creek, PA; active New York, NY and New Brunswick, NJ

texts.textentryhtml: Robert Watts Estate, New Paltz, New York, gift; to Princeton University Art Museum, 2012.

As Watts wrote in his introduction to Notes and Sketches, “These sketches and notes refer to projects for exploration and development, many of which were modified during the process of bringing them to fruition . . . . Usually I was never much interested in explaining what I was doing. The doing was important, whether to note ideas and thoughts, or to make an object or other work such as an environment or performance, mainly to give the idea some kind of form in order to see what that would be like. Sometimes in the making I was surprised at the results; other times the making led to new realizations of even greater import for me as though the original idea was only a hint of what was forming within.”

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2012," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 71/72 (2012-13): p. 105-132.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2012," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 71/72 (2012-13): p. 105-132., p. 123
